Test your mettle and command mastery in The Crucible. All mastery challenges are active at once and can be completed out of order. Gain bonus Perk points upon completion of each mastery challenge.

After the invasion of William the Conqueror, England would never be the same. It entered an era of accelerated progress, seeing the formation of modern-style governance, the construction of enduring castles, and the battlefield domination of its key weapon for centuries to come: the longbow.

In the face of invasion, plague and revolt, medieval France paved a hard-won path from adversity to prosperity. Once a land of fragmented rule bound to a code of chivalry, a unified nation emerged, forged under the roar of cannon fire.

The Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation claimed to be the rightful successor to the ancient Roman Empire. Its emperors controlled central Europe with a stalwart army of hardened infantrymen, and aimed to capture the center of the Christian world itself: Rome.

From the engineering feat of the Great Wall to the finely tuned chemistry of gunpowder, China's mastery of warfare ensured centuries of unbroken dynastic rule. Its ingenious inventions were the awe of the Middle Ages, forever cementing China as one of the great forces of technological progress in human history.

Founded by a former slave boy, the Sultanate of Delhi rose to encompass almost the whole Indian subcontinent at the height of its rule. A melting pot of Hindu and Muslim cultures, it boasted elaborate architecture, world-renowned metal working, and the terrifying force of its thousands-strong elephant corps.

Under the unifying rule of Genghis Khan, warring Mongolian tribes came together and forged the largest empire the world has ever known. What they lacked in resources, they made up for in cunning, skill, and efficiency. The Mongol Empire aimed for nothing less than world domination.

Hardened by devastating invasions, political instability, and long, bitter winters, the Rus were built for survival. Masters of hunting, trade, and wooden construction, they would rebuild their broken realm, as their leaders fought to birth a new empire under Moscow.

Born of the fertile crescent in the modern-day Middle East, the Abbasid Caliphate ruled over the Islamic world for hundreds of years. It oversaw a great period of flourishing and technological innovation known as the "Golden Age of Islam", bringing the medieval world racing towards the modern era.
Train before engaging more worthy opponents. To be assured of victory, train until you are destined to win.

One of the world's most enduring empires sprung from humble nomadic roots in a small corner of Anatolia. The Ottoman Empire was made resilient by an effective and stable government supported by a well-trained and regimented military.

From the lush coasts of West Africa to the dry sands of the Sahara, the medieval Malian Empire grew to become the largest and most prosperous empire in North Africa. Its incredible wealth in gold and salt, its stable trade routes, and its highly mobile army made its influence felt across the continents.

Emerging from the chaos of civil war, the Japanese Shogunate sought stability and strength. It built a powerful, organized military and developed some of the most advanced gunpowder weapons of the era.

In Constantinople, at the confluence of east and west, a young post-Roman empire battled its way to dominance. Now known as the Byzantines, the Eastern Romans spread their culture, architecture, and immense martial power the length and breadth of the Mediterranean.

Accrue 5,000 Wood in a single match.
Gather Wood from trees around the map. Wood is used primarily for construction and producing units.
Win a match as the French.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Accrue 5,000 Stone in a single match.
Gather Stone from Stone Outcroppings around the map. Stone is used primarily for building strong defensive structures.
Gather Gold from Gold Veins around the map, or from Traders or Trade Ships that trade with Markets or Docks. Gold is used primarily for researching technology and producing units.
Construct and defend a Wonder to achieve a Wonder Victory.
Fully upgrade yourMen-at-Arms to Veteran Men-at-Arms in a match.
Research allMan-at-Arms unit technologies in the Barracks.
Fully upgrade your Spearmen to EliteSpearmen in a match.
Research all Spearman unit technologies in the Barracks.
Fully upgrade your Archers to Elite Archers in a match.
Research all Archer unit technologies in the Archery Range.
Fully upgrade your Knights to EliteKnights in a match.
Research all Knight or Lancer unit technologies in the Stable.
Kill 20 enemy units with ranged infantry during a match.
Units of this type are weak to cavalry units. Keep your ranged infantry at a distance by positioning them safely, or using other units to shield them.
Kill 20 enemy units with cavalry in a match.
Units of this type are able to charge into battle quickly – but watch out for Palings. These wooden stakes can stop a cavalry charge dead in its tracks.
Kill 20 enemy units with melee infantry in a match.
Units of this type are only effective in melee range. Close the gap on unsuspecting enemies by using Stealth Forests, the Fog of War, or by using other units as a distraction.
Kill 20 enemy units with siege engines in a match.
Units of this type are unmatched at range, but cannot defend themselves in melee. Protect your siege line with other units to get the most out of them.
Produce 30 gunpowder units in a match.
Produce units of this type from the Archery Range or Siege Workshop. These units are available in the later ages, and are more effective than basic ranged infantry.
Produce 60 melee infantry in a match.
Produce units of this type from the Barracks. Melee infantry can be produced as early as the Dark Age (I), and form the core of your military strength.
Produce 5 siege engines in the field in a match.

Research Siege Engineering and produce Battering Rams or Siege Towers from infantry units in the field.  Rams are effective at breaking down superior stone defenses, whereas Siege Towers let your army scale enemy walls.
Produce 30 ranged infantry in a match.
Produce units of this type from the Archery Range. Ranged infantry are highly effective from a distance, but require some protection.
Upgrade 3 Outposts with the Fortify Outpost emplacement in a match.
Each Outpost must purchase the Fortify Outpost emplacement individually.
Upgrade 3 buildings with arrowslits in a match.
Each Outpost or Keep must research the Arrowslits emplacement individually.
Upgrade 2 buildings with springald emplacements during a match.
Each Outpost or Keep must research the Springald Emplacement individually.
Upgrade 2 buildings with Cannon Emplacements in a match.
Each Outpost or Keep must purchase its Cannon Emplacement individually.
Produce 10 siege engines in a match.

Produce units of this type from the Siege Workshop. Siege engines have their own specialties, and can be effective versus buildings or enemy units. Picking the right siege engines to fit your army can be the difference between victory and defeat.
Kill an enemy Scout or Khan in the Dark Age (I).
English Villagers can attack at range with longbows, and the English Town Center has increased defensive capabilities to stop enemy scouting in its tracks.
Produce 30 Longbowmen from the Council Hall in the Feudal Age (II).
The Council Hall Landmark produces Longbowmen. The Archery Range is not required.
Win a game as the English.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Build the King's Palace and produce 10 Villagers from it in the Castle Age (III).
The King's Palace acts as a Town Center, giving the English another option for Villager production.
Reach the Castle Age (III) with 16 Farms influenced by Mills.
Farms placed directly around a Mill receive a bonus to harvest rate.
Setup 5 simultaneous camps, with at least one unit gaining benefit from each camp.
The English Scout's Setup Camp ability creates a campfire that improves the line of sight for nearby units.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
The English are able to produce units from Keeps.
Defeat 50 enemies with units affected by the Network of Castles.

The Network of Castles bonus provides a defensive advantage to the English. Enemies that approach your defensive buildings will trigger an alarm, causing your nearby units to fire faster while the alarm is active.
Defeat 20 enemies with Longbowmen affected by the Arrow Volley upgrade.
Research Arrow Volley in the Archery Range. Fully upgraded Longbowmen are strong, but still require protection from melee attackers.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Research the Enclosures upgrade on the Mill to gather Gold from Farm Enclosures.
Produce 5 Wynguard Armies from the Wynguard Palace.
The Wynguard Palace produces multiple units simultaneously.
Destroy 20 enemy units with Trebuchets affected by the Shattering Projectiles technology.
Research Shattering Projectiles in the Siege Workshop. Trebuchets are susceptible to melee units – keep them guarded.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Gather Food from Berry Bushes or from hunting wild animals – such as Sheep, Deer, or Boar. Food can also be gathered from the sea, either by Fishing Ships or Villagers fishing from the shoreline.
Fully upgrade your Crossbowmen to Elite Crossbowmen in a match.
Research all Crossbowman unit technologies in the Archery Range.
Destroy your enemies' Landmarks and Town Centers to achieve a Landmarks Victory.
Win a match as the English.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Win a team game in Quick Match.
Win a game in any match type.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Complete a match in Skirmish, Multiplayer or Campaign.
Win or lose – play to the end of your match.
Win a game as the French.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the School of Cavalry Landmark and then produce 20 cavalry units.
The School of Cavalry gives a unit production speed bonus to all cavalry units produced in Stables or the Landmark itself.
Accrue 500 Food or Wood from Traders.

Unique to the French, Traders can trade for more than just Gold. Supplement your economy with resources that are hard to come by, or double down on stockpiling a resource you're going to need plenty of.
Produce 40 Royal Knights from a Stable under the influence of a nearby Keep.
Construct Keeps nearby to Stables to take advantage of an increase to cavalry production speed.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Research Crossbow Stirrups and defeat 20 enemy units with Arbaltriers.
Research Crossbow Stirrups in the Archery Range. Pavise shields provide added protection against ranged attacks, making the Arbaltrier a great counter to other ranged units.
Construct the Red Palace Landmark and use it to kill 30 enemies.
The Red Palace Landmark functions as a Keep – including the ability to upgrade it with deadly weapons.
Accrue 2,000 Food, Wood, Gold, or Stone from the Guild Hall Landmark in the Castle Age (III).
The French are able to trade Gold for other resources in the Guild Hall Landmark.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Win the match with a surviving army of 25 cavalry.
The French have many cavalry-focused technologies to boost their survivability and damage. Choose the combination that best suits your playstyle.
Kill 10 enemy units with Galleasses affected by the Armored Hull technology.
The Galleass is a unique French ship armed with forward mounted bombards. This ship is vulnerable from the sides, but the Armored Hull technology can alleviate this.
Achieve a Wonder victory while 20 Traders are active.
Heavy defenses will be needed to keep your Wonder safe, all while more resources are trickling in.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Accrue 1500 resources and have a population of 15 before the Feudal Age (II).
An early focus on economy is important to any civilization.
Collect 250 Gold in tax with an Imperial Official before the Castle Age (III).
Imperial Officials automatically collect taxes from economy buildings that are in use, such as Mills and Camps.
Win a game as the Chinese.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Produce 20 Zhuge Nu and use them to defeat 30 enemies.
Enter the Song Dynasty to be able to produce Zhuge Nu crossbowmen.
Construct 2 Villages and achieve a Population of 100 before the Castle Age (III).
Villages significantly increase your population capacity.
Supervise the production of 30 military units with an Official.
The Supervise ability allows you to order an Official to supervise a military production building to increase its capabilities.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Generate 500 Gold in tax at buildings affected by the Imperial Academy's increased tax revenue.
Buildings producing units, researching technology, and ambiently adding income, such as the Pagoda, generate additional tax when near the Imperial Academy.
Construct the Spirit Way Landmark and research all upgrades within it.
You must establish the Song and Yuan Dynasties in order to research all of the Spirit Way upgrades.
Defeat 40 enemies with siege engines from the Astronomical Clocktower before you lose 20 of your Clocktower siege engines.
The Astronomical Clocktower allows production of superior siege engines.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 50 enemies with infantry or cavalry units equipped with Gunpowder weapons.
Many Chinese gunpowder units are also dynasty units.
Generate 1500 of each resource type (Food, Wood, and Stone) from your Pagodas.
Pagodas generate additional Food, Wood, and Stone when holding Relics.
Achieve a Landmarks Victory while in the Ming Dynasty.
The Ming Dynasty increases military unit health.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Gather 500 resources with Villagers affected by Holy Inspiration in the Dark Age (I).
Use a Prelate to inspire Villagers with Holy Inspiration as they harvest resources.
Construct 20 buildings within the range of influence of a Town Center.
Buildings within the influence of Town Centers can be repaired quickly using the Emergency Repair ability.
Win a game as the Holy Roman Empire.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 15 enemy units with Men-At-Arms affected by the Two-Handed Weapons technology.
Research the Two-Handed Weapons technology in the Barracks.
Produce a force of 30 infantry before the Imperial Age (IV).
Research Marching Drills at the Blacksmith.
Win 2 games as the Holy Roman Empire.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Regnitz Cathedral, place a Relic within it, and accrue 3,000 Gold from it.
Relics can be found on the map. Transport a Relic to the Regnitz Cathedral with a Prelate to accrue Gold.
The Landsknecht can be produced from the Barracks upon reaching the Castle Age (III).
Accrue 1,000 Gold from Relics placed within Monasteries, Keeps, Docks, Stone Wall Towers, or Outposts.
Relics can be found all across the map. An optional technology, Tithe Barns, also provides additional resources when Relics are placed within Monasteries.
Win 5 games as the Holy Roman Empire.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Elzbach Palace and then construct 3 Keeps within influence.
The Elzbach Palace gives structures within the range of Influence increased defenses. Your Keeps will be much harder to destroy.
Prelates holding a Relic can use the Conversion ability, which has a chance to convert nearby enemies to the Holy Roman Empire.
Research Reinforced Defenses and then achieve a Wonder victory.
Research Reinforced Defenses in the Keep. With increased defenses you can defend your Wonder from your opponents.
Win 10 games as the Holy Roman Empire.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Increase the yield of 6 or more Berry Bushes before reaching the Feudal Age (II).
Constructing a Mill near Berry Bushes increases the amount of Food available.
Construct 5 Palisade Walls without using Villagers.
Sultanate Infantry can build Palisade Walls.
Win a game as the Delhi Sultanate.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Produce 5 scholars from the Dome of Faith landmark.
Only scholars produced from the Dome of Faith count for completion.
Defeat 20 enemies with units affected by the Tower of Victory attack increase.
Your infantry must be trained from a building within the Sultanate Influence while having the Tower of Victory constructed.
Research 20 technologies in buildings influenced by Mosques or Madrasas.
Research buildings must be within the influence distance of a garrisoned Mosque to get increased research speed.
Win 2 games as the Delhi Sultanate.
Win two games in any type of match including campaign.
Produce 20 military units from buildings you have garrisoned Scholars in.
Research Efficient Production to be able to garrison a Scholar in military production buildings.
Use your military units to construct 1000 Stone’s worth of structures.
The Compound of the Defender grants Stone construction to Military Units.
Use Mosques to heal 500 total health on your units.
The Tranquil Venue technology allows Mosques to heal nearby units.
Win 5 games as the Delhi Sultanate.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
The Village Fortresses technology allows Keeps to produce Villagers and Scouts.
Construct the Palace of the Sultan, produce 10 elephants, and destroy 10 enemy buildings.
The elephants produced do not need to come from the Palace of the Sultan, however it does help.
Research Swiftness and then achieve a Sacred Victory.
Swiftness research is available at the Mosque.
Win 10 games as the Delhi Sultanate.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Train 3 Early Horsemen units before the Feudal Age (II).
The Mongols have the advantage of fast-moving cavalry available during the Dark Age (I).
Use the Improved Production ability to produce 2 Villagers before the Feudal Age (II).
Your Town Center must be within the influence of an Ovoo to access Improved Production for Villagers.
Win a game as the Mongols.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Silver Tree Landmark and 5 outposts. Gain the Yam speed aura 40 times with your Traders.
Setting up Outposts along your trade route greatly increases the speed of your Traders.
Accrue 500 Stone by igniting enemy buildings.
Researching Stone Bounty, found in the Ovoo, adds stone as a reward for raiding.
Produce 40 cavalry units using improved production buildings influenced by an Ovoo.
Buildings within the influence of an Ovoo can spend Stone on improved production items. Improved production produces two units instead of one.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Researching Stone Commerce and having 9 or more Traders active allows Traders to supply Stone.
Research the Yam Network, then defeat 20 enemies with units affected by the Yam speed aura.
Yam Network allows any friendly unit to be affected by the Yam speed aura.
Produce 30 Sheep from Pastures that are influenced by an Ovoo.
Building a Pasture within the influence of an Ovoo will spawn Sheep faster. Gaining an early Food advantage with well-placed Pastures can secure a stable economy.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Kurultai and heal 500 health on your units via the Kurultai.
The Kurultai heals damaged units nearby.
Defeat 40 enemies with units affected by the Khan's Signal Arrows.
Use the Mongol's speed and reach advantage to keep troops enhanced and the Khan alive.
Research the Improved Siha Bow Limbs technology, then defeat 40 enemies with Mangudai, and achieve a Landmarks Victory.
The Improved Siha Bow Limbs technology is found in the Archery Range.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct 4 resource drop-off buildings in the Dark Age (I).
Mills, Lumber Camps, and Mining Camps are considered resource drop-off buildings. The French can construct these at a reduced cost.
Research Horticulture, Double Broadax, and Specialized Pick before reaching the Castle Age (III).
Research these technologies in the Mill, Lumber Camp, and Mining Camp, respectively. The French can research economic technologies at a lower cost – setting the stage for a prosperous economy.
Research Herbal Medicine in the Monastery.
Accumulate 50 bounty by hunting Deer, Sheep, or Boar in the Dark Age (I).
The Rus can achieve special bonuses and Gold by accruing bounty – which is gained by gathering food from animals.
Construct 4 Lumber Camps within the range of influence of a Wooden Fortress.
Villagers dropping off harvested Wood to a Lumber Camp within the influence of a Wooden Fortress receive additional Wood for their efforts.
Win a game as the Rus.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Accrue 250 Gold from Hunting Cabins in the Dark Age (I).

Choose your placement for Hunting Cabins strategically. The farther into the wilderness – especially near wooded areas – the more Gold you will receive. Hunting Cabins are more effective when you have earned a high bounty total.
Construct 25 Fortified Palisade Walls with Villagers in the Dark Age (I).
The Rus' Palisade Walls are more effective than that of other civilizations.
Use the Golden Gate Landmark to make 5 trades in the Feudal Age (II).
The Rus can use the Golden Gate Landmark to trade resources.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 15 enemies with Early Knights in the Feudal Age (II).
Rus gain access to Knights earlier than other civilizations – beat the rush with a rush of your own.
Defeat 20 enemies with units affected by Saint's Blessing.
Warrior Monks are fearsome fighters that do well in the center of battle. While fighting, Warrior Monks trigger Saint's Blessing – which improves the effectiveness of nearby combatants.
Research Boyar's Fortitude and then defeat 30 enemies with cavalry.
Research Boyar's Fortitude in the Blacksmith.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Research two upgrades from the High Armory and produce 20 siege engines in the Imperial Age (IV).
The High Armory contains unique technologies for Rus siege engines – which can strengthen your hold on the late game.
Research Chemistry and then defeat 30 enemies with Streltsy.
Achieve a Sacred Victory with fully upgraded Warrior Monks.

Construct the Abbey of the Trinity Landmark to gain access to unique Warrior Monk technologies – Saint's Veneration and Fervor. The Herbal Medicine, Piety, and Divine Light upgrades can be found in the Monastery as well.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Accrue a sum total of 1,000 resources before the first wing of your House of Wisdom is complete.
The resources can be from any source; Food, Wood, Stone or Gold and they add together. The Abbasid Dynasty should be able to maintain peak resource collection while building their Landmark.
Research the first technology available from a wing in your House of Wisdom, before reaching the Castle Age (III).
Each of the wings gives you one unique technology to choose from. These are important to your development and should be researched as soon as possible.
Research 30 technologies discounted by the Preservation of Knowledge.
For a technology to count, it must be started after researching Preservation of Knowledge.
Accrue 5000 gold from your Traders after researching Spice Roads.
Gold accrued only counts once you have researched Spice Roads.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Produce 100 military units after achieving Tier 3 of the Golden Age.
Tier 3 of the Golden Age increases production speed of your units. The production of military units only counts after achieving Tier 3.
Defeat 15 enemy cavalry units with your Camel Riders.
Camels are designed as anti-cavalry, use Camel Riders in this manner to defeat enemy cavalry.
Heal 3000 health on friendly units using your Medical Centers.
After researching Medical Centers, bring injured units nearby to receive healing.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct 10 ranged siege units with your melee infantry.
Abbasid melee infantry units can construct ranged siege units in the field.
Win a game as the Abbasid.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 30 enemy units with Infantry who are receiving support from Camels.
Research the Camel Support technology and then stand your infantry within radius of a camel to gain the benefit. Infantry include non-cavalry ranged units.
Win a Wonder Victory after achieving Tier 3 of the Golden Age.
Reaching Tier 3 of the Golden Age indicates a strong economy, culture and military structure is in place. This should make a Wonder victory achievable.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Increase the yield of 18 Berry Bushes and accrue 9000 Food.
The Abbasid Dynasty can increase the Food available per Berry Bush by placing a Mill nearby.
Complete The Hundred Years War campaign.
Complete The Rise of Moscow campaign.
Loot the Danish war camp during the North to York mission.
Extend the Network of Castles alarm across 12 buildings simultaneously as the English.
Charge an enemy with 50 Royal Knights simultaneously as the French.
Raid an enemy building in the Dark Age (I) as the Mongols.
Enhance 100 units with a single Khan Signal Arrow as the Mongols.
Win a match without your Khan being killed as the Mongols.
Accrue 10,000 Stone in a single match as the Mongols.
Win a match without producing infantry as the French.
Destroy 1,000 enemy units with gunpowder siege engines as the French.
Accrue 1,000 Food from Traders in a single match as the French.
Accrue 2,000 Gold with Hunting Cabins in a single match as the Rus.
Earn 500 Gold from bounties in a match as the Rus.
Reveal 300 Villagers with a single use of Imperial Spies as the Chinese.
Construct 1,000 Stone Walls as the Chinese.
Move Like Wind, Attack Like Fire
Defeat 1,000 enemy units with the Nest of Bees as the Chinese.
Establish all of the Dynasties in a single match as the Chinese.
Gather Wood 1,000 times as the Rus.
Enhance 10 units with a single Saint's Blessing strike as the Rus.
Destroy 100 enemy buildings with your elephants as the Delhi Sultanate.
Build a Stone Wall, Gate, and Tower using infantry as the Delhi Sultanate.
Have 20 Scholars garrisoned in a Madrasa as the Delhi Sultanate.
Research all technologies in a matchas the Delhi Sultanate.
Convert 30 enemies without holding a Relic as the Abbasid Dynasty.
During a match, research everything in the wings of the Abbasid House of Wisdom.
Defeat 1,000 enemy cavalry units with your Camel Riders as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Achieve the third tier of the Golden Age as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Win a match without producing cavalry as the Holy Roman Empire.
Have at least 60 simultaneously inspired Villagers as the Holy Roman Empire.
Begin capturing a Sacred Site immediately upon entering Age III as the Holy Roman Empire.
Achieve a Landmarks Victory in the Dark Age (I).
Achieve a Sacred Victory without losing a religious unit.
Achieve a Wonder Victory without constructing walls.
Assume control of 25 units in a single conversion.
Destroy 5 enemies with a single Demolition Ship detonation.
Advance to the next Age 500 times.
Win a match during which fishing was your only source of gathered Food.
Win a 1v1 match against the Easy A.I.
Win a 1v1 match against the Intermediate A.I.
Win a 1v1 match against the Hard A.I.
Win a 1v1 match against the Hardest A.I.
Complete an Art of War challenge or a campaign mission.
Any Art of War training challenge or campaign mission counts toward completing this Mastery. You can replay the same mission or challenge to get additional progress.
Complete an Art of War challenge or a campaign mission.
Any Art of War training challenge or campaign mission counts toward completing this Mastery. You can replay the same mission or challenge to get additional progress.
Complete an Art of War challenge or a campaign mission.
Any Art of War training challenge or campaign mission counts toward completing this Mastery. You can replay the same mission or challenge to get additional progress.
Complete an Art of War challenge or a campaign mission.
Any Art of War training challenge or campaign mission counts toward completing this Mastery. You can replay the same mission or challenge to get additional progress.
Complete an Art of War challenge or a campaign mission.
Any Art of War training challenge or campaign mission counts toward completing this Mastery. You can replay the same mission or challenge to get additional progress.
Produce units of this type from the Stable. Cavalry are fast-moving and effective at shutting down ranged infantry – if they can close the gap.
Research 3 technologies from the Mill during a match.
Technology available in the Mill makes Villagers or Scouts more effective at gathering Food.
Research 2 technologies from the Mining Camp during a match.
Technology available in the Mining Camp make Stone or Gold gathering more effective.
Research 5 technologies from the Blacksmith during a match.
Technology available in the Blacksmith increases the effectiveness of your army.
Research 3 technologies from the Monastery, Mosque, or Prayer Tent during a match.
Technologies available in the Monastery, Mosque, or Prayer Tent increase the effectiveness of units produced from there.
Research 5 technologies from the University or Madrasa during a match.
Technology available in the University increases the effectiveness of all unit types, but is only available in the Imperial Age (IV).
Fully upgrade your Horsemen to EliteHorsemen in a match.
Research all Horseman unit technologies in the Stables.
Win a match as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Warships are already powerful ships, but their damage can be further upgraded by researching Chemistry in the University.
Produce 10 Demolition Ships and research Explosives during a match.
Produce Demolition Ships and research Explosives from the Docks.
Accrue 1,000 Gold from Trade Ships during a match.
Produce Trade Ships from the Docks. These ships can trade with other Docks to receive Gold.
Research 5 technologies from the Docks during a match.
Research Naval Technology from the Docks.
Produce units of this type from the Docks. Ships can traverse the seas to fish, fight, or transport your armies to distant shores.
Accrue 1,000 Food from Fishing Ships during a match.
Produce Fishing Ships from the Docks. Fishing Ships can harvest fish from the sea.
Construct 2 Keeps during a match as the English.
English Keeps can be upgraded into formidable defensive structures. They can also trigger the Network of Castles, which increases the effectiveness of nearby ranged infantry.
Produce 15 Royal Knights during a match as the French.
French Royal Knights are unique units that are available in the early ages. These heavily armored cavalry and their fearsome charges can break enemy lines with ease.
Inspire 20 Villagers during a match as the Holy Roman Empire.
Inspire Villagers with a Prelate to increase their gathering effectiveness. Many Villagers can be inspired simultaneously.
Accrue 500 bounty from hunting during a match as the Rus.
When the Rus hunt animals in the wild, they earn a bounty. Bounties grant unique bonuses across the civilization.
Establish a dynasty during a match as the Chinese.
The Chinese can choose to establish a dynasty, granting unique bonuses and unlocking unique units.
Produce 10 military units from buildings garrisoned with Scholars in a match as the Delhi Sultanate.
Research Efficient Production to be able to garrison a Scholar in military production buildings.
Construct a Wing from the House of Wisdom during a match as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Construct any of the four Wings from the House of Wisdom. Each Wing gives unique benefits.
Use a Signal Arrow ability during a match as the Mongols.
The Khan has the ability to use Signal Arrows to affect nearby allied units. The correct Signal Arrow at just the right moment can turn the tides of battle in the Mongols' favor.
Don't lose any Huihui Pao during the Fall of Xiangyang.
Kill 100 enemies with Keeps as the English.
Use the Setup Camp ability 20 times as the English.
Shutdown a Cavalry Charge with Palings as the English.
Capture and hold Sacred Sites on the map to achieve a Sacred Victory.
Sink an enemy Transport Ship that is garrisoned to maximum capacity.
Kill double the enemies as Batu when assaulting the bridge in the Battle of Mohi.
Don't lose any Mangudaiduring the Battle of the Kalka River.
Yeah, Well, You Should See the Other Guy
Lose a unit to the Front Gate ofZhangjiakouduring the Great Wall mission.
Enlist the aid of 45 Knights during the Battle of Tinchebray.
Defeat the siege before the Keep takes damage during the First Battle of Lincoln.
Earn a medal in 3 Art of War challenges.
Earn your first gold medal in an Art of War challenge.
Earn a gold medal in 5 Art of War challenges.
To Remind, To Advise, To Warn
Stop any of the city's walls being destroyed during the Siege of Wallingford.
Pay off the Mongols within 3 minutes during the Tribute mission.
Stop the Mongols from entering the outer city during Hold Against the Horde.
Kill 50 enemies with Wooden Fortresses during the Great Stand on the Ugra River.
Destroy all enemy units and production buildings during the Siege of Kazan.
Du Bois Are Back in Town
Win in the arena without losing more than 10 units during the Combat of the Thirty.
Collect every treasure chest during the Battle of Patay.
Field a Royal siege unit with all the brothers' bonuses during Retake Normandy.
Win the Battle of Formigny without losing any cannons.
A New Age Is Upon Us
Complete the Advanced Combat Art of War challenge
Complete a Skirmish or Custom match with a mod active
Subscribe to a mod from the Mods tab, then create a Skirmish or Custom lobby to play it! You can also join a Custom match where a host has selected mods.
Unlock the Yuan and/or Ming Dynasties as the Chinese
Establishing a Dynasty in a match is a powerful way to specialize your army's strength. You can do so by building both Landmarks for the same Age.
Play through The Combat of the Thirty mission in The Hundred Years War campaign
Completing the North to York mission in The Normans campaign will unlock The Combat of the Thirty.
Watch a Replay from your or another player’s Profile
You can view a player's replay from the Match History screen on their Profile as long as they have chosen to share it.
Produce 200 or more units in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match
Build the Regnitz Cathedral and place a Relic in an eligible building as the Holy Roman Empire.
You can place a Relic in any Monastery, Dock, Outpost, Stone Wall Tower, and Keep to complete this challenge, but placing a Relic in defenses or a Dock offers extra bonuses in addition to Gold.
Kill a King while playing the Royal Rumble game mode mod
Subscribe to the Royal Rumble mod from the Mods tab and create a Skirmish or Custom match to play it! You can also join a Custom match where the host has selected Royal Rumble.
Win a 1v1 Custom or Skirmish match against any difficulty A.I.
Research 10 upgrades in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match
Build 3 Rams using only infantry before reaching the Castle Age as the Abbasid Dynasty
Abbasid infantry units are able to construct Rams in the field, provided you have enough resources.
Defeat 10 enemy units with Springalds during The Siege of Paris mission in The Hundred Years War campaign
Completing the The Combat of the Thirty mission inThe Hundred Years War campaign will unlock The Siege of Paris.
Earn a Bronze, Silver, or Gold medal in any Art of War challenge
Construct a Wonder in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match
Destroy a Stone Wall with War Elephants as the Delhi Sultanate
Complete the Kalka River mission without losing 25 units
Defeat 10 enemy Villagers with Demolition Ships in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match
Complete the Great Stand on the Ugra River mission
Build 3 additional Town Centers in the Late Economy Art of War mission
Win a match where all Gold earned from trading comes from Trade Ships
Destroy an enemy Dock with a Warship
Complete The Battle of Mohi campaign mission on Intermediate difficulty in under 15 minutes
Your fastest elapsed time for each mission can be viewed on the Campaign tab. Note that the Show Game Duration option in Settings displays your total time, including cinematics.
Play a match with a modded Game Mode on a modded Crafted or Generated Map using a Tuning Pack
Subscribe to a mod from the Mods tab, then create a Skirmish or Custom lobby to play it! You can also join a Custom match where a host has selected mods.
Achieve a Sacred Victory in a 1v1 match against the Hardest A.I.
Earn a Gold medal without losing a building in the Basic Combat Art of War mission
Research the Additional Sails upgrade in a Multiplayer match
Destroy an enemy building in the Dark Age during a Multiplayer or Skirmish match
Loot the Routiers' camp during the France in Chaos mission
Progress through every Age in a Multiplayer match
Each time you Age up, your civilization's language evolves with it
Conquer the North by playing through the Formigny mission on Hard difficulty
Kill 2 Scout units in a Multiplayer match
Garrison 10 Villagers in your Town Center
Produce 5 Warships in a Multiplayer match
Win a 1v2 Skirmish as the Mongols, facing two Easy A.I. opponents.
Generate 1,000 Gold resources from an Open Pit Gold Mine with 4 Houses within its influence
Constructing an Open Pit Mine over a Gold Deposit passively generates Gold. Constructing Houses within influence of the Open Pit Mine, however, further strengthens this bonus.
Donso have better defensive capabilities than other Spearmen thanks to their shield, and are able to deal damage at range with their javelin throw.
Win a game as the Malians.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Use the Mill to produce Cattle. Cattle will generate Food over time when assigned to the Ranch building.
Defeat 20 ranged units with Javelin Throwers or Mansa Javelineers.
Javelin Throwers have more range than most other ranged units - making them a great counter. However, they aren't very fast-moving and are susceptible to cavalry.
Malian ranged infantry can be upgraded with Poisoned Arrows, which applies damage over time to enemies.
Construct the Fort of the Huntress and kill 40 units with Musofadi Gunners.

Musofadi Gunners excel at hit-and-run tactics - and their ambush damage when attacking from a stealth forest can be the start of a favorable fight. First-strike ambush bonus provides will be applied to stats.
Throw all three Festivals with the Griot Bara in Age IV.
The Griot Bara Landmark can establish Festivals that the entire Malian civilization benefits from. Each Festival has its own unique effects.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Produce 20 Freeborn Warrior and 20 Mansa Musofadi Warrior units from the Farimba Garrison.
The Farimba Garrison unlocks one of three unique units in the Castle Age. A second of the three units can be unlocked in the Imperial Age.
Gather 500 Gold from Traders passing by Toll Outposts.
Malian Outposts act as a Toll Outpost, which gathers Gold from nearby Traders while they are on route gathering Gold.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Research the Local Knowledge technology and when revealed from stealth heal 500 total health on your Musofadi units.
Musofadi units can be upgraded with the Local Knowledge technology.
Upgrade Sofa Horsemen with the Imported Armor upgrade and kill 50 units.
While the Malians do not have access to Knights - Sofa Horsemen can be upgraded to cover that role in later ages.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct a Sultanhani Trade Network and garrison Traders within it to maximum capacity.
The Ottomans can garrison Traders within their Sultanhani Trade Network Landmark to produce Gold. The Ottomans take time to reach their stride, so an early economic advantage is crucial.
Construct a Twin Minaret Medrese and harvest 2,000 Food.
Cultivation of the surrounding lands was a staple of Ottoman supremacy. An additional Food source can make the difference in military production as you reach Age II.
Win a game as the Ottomans.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 10 ranged enemies with Sipahis affected by Fortitude.
Sipahis were renowned for their agility and maneuverability. This especially works in their favor when flanking enemy ranged units.
Research 5 Imperial Council bonuses before reaching Age IV.

You can gain experience towards Viziers, which allows you to research unique upgrades with the Imperial Council. Not all bonuses can be achieved in a single game, so you will need to prioritize accordingly.
Have 10 Mehters playing their war drums simultaneously.
Mehters can apply unique bonuses. Choosing the right bonus at the right time can be the difference between victory and defeat.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct at least 3 Military Schools and produce 100 units from them.
The Military School can produce units passively, allowing you to focus your economy more freely.
Janissaries are adept at picking off enemy cavalry, but their ability to repair siege units in the field should not be discounted.
Research the Imperial Fleet upgrade, then construct 10 Cannon Ships.
The Imperial Fleet upgrade, researched in the Docks, reduces the train time and improves the move speed of cannon ships.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Sea Gate Castle Landmark and have 5 Keeps providing Trade Protection.
All Ottoman Castles provide this bonus to Traders and Trade Ships, and the Sea Gate Castle Landmark is no exception.
Construct the Istanbul Observatory then produce 100 units.
Universities provide an increase to unit production speed for nearby military production buildings. This Landmark, however, further increases that bonus.
Destroy 3 enemy Keeps with the Great Bombard.
The Great Bombard has unparalleled damage at a far range. However, it is revealed to enemies when it prepares to fire. Be on the lookout and protect your Great Bombards from counterattack.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Win a match as the Ottomans.
Have 5 Military Schools active at the same time as the Ottomans.
Generate tax from 5 Toll Outposts on a single trip as the Malians.
Earn a gold medal in the Ottoman Art of War challenge.
Defeat 500 units with Poisoned Arrow as the Malians.
Garrison units into 3 Trebuchets as the Ottomans.
Destroy a Wonder with a Great Bombard as the Ottomans.
Earn a gold medal in the Malian Art of War challenge.
Defeat 500 enemies with units affected by Mehteran as the Ottomans.
Gather Gold 1,000 times from Open Pit Mines as the Malians.
Defeat a Heavy Cavalry unit with a Poisoned Arrow as the Malians.
Defeat 100 ranged units with a Sipahi unit as the Ottomans.
Unlock 7 Imperial Council upgrades in a single match as the Ottomans.
Win a match as the Malians.
Attack 100 enemies with invisible Musofadi Warriors or Gunners in a single match as the Malians.
Garrison 20 Cattle in Ranches at the same time as the Malians.
Gather 1997 Fish as a Food Source in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Age of Empires was originally released in 1997 by Ensemble Studios.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match by never exceeding a population of 50.
In the original Age of Empires, the maximum population cap in Single Player was 50 units.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match without repairing any structures with Villagers.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match as the Ottomans.
The Ottoman civilization was first introduced in Age of Empires III.
Defeat 25 enemy units only using Cavalry.
2022 is the 25th anniversary of the Age of Empires franchise.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match without losing more than 5 Villagers.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match in which you don't produce any Siege or Naval units.
Age of Empires II: Age of Kings was originally released in 1999. The opening cutscene shows 2 kings playing a Chess game representing their units on the battlefield.
Research at least 4 technologies before reaching Age IV in a match.
Age of Empires IV was released in 2021.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match as the Malians.
The Malians were first introduced in the Age of Empires II HD: African Kingdoms.
Load 16 Elephant units into a Transport Ship.
If you have an Ottoman ally, you could load up to 25 Elephant units on a Grand Galley ship.
Destroy 5 buildings with a French Warship.
In Age of Empires III, leading a scrappy crew of Caribbean buccaneers, Elizabet Ramsey sails aboard her flagship, Paris Burning.
Defeat the Polish army before the Bohemian army arrives in the Battle of Liegnitz mission.
Defeat units with only melee units and win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Win a 2v2 Quick Match without using animals as a food source.
Achieve a Sacred Victory with another player against Intermediate A.I. in a 2v2 Custom match on King of the Hill.
Produce 40 or more Villagers in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Destroy 5 Naval units using Springald Ships in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Build an additional Town Center in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match as the Chinese.
Build 8 Naval units in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match as the Malians.
Survive at least 18 minutes in the Ottomans Art of War Challenge.
Generate 1,000 Food from the Ranch in a Multiplayer match as the Malians.
Use the Mill to produce Cattle. Cattle will generate Food over time when assigned to the Ranch building.
Build an Open Pit Mine in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Malians.
Constructing an Open Pit Mine over a Gold Deposit passively generates Gold. Constructing Houses within influence of the Open Pit Mine, however, further strengthens this bonus.
Build 2 Military Schools in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Ottomans.
The Military School can produce units passively, allowing you to focus your economy more freely.
Destroy a Keep or an Outpost with a Great Bombard in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Ottomans.
The Great Bombard has unparalleled damage at a far range. However, it is revealed to enemies when it prepares to fire. Be on the lookout and protect your Great Bombards from counterattack.
Win a match as the Malians.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Win a match as the Ottomans.
Win in Standard, Ranked, Skirmish or Custom matches.
Produce 10 Camel units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Camels are designed as anti-cavalry, use Camel Riders in this manner to defeat enemy cavalry.
Produce 10 Firelancer units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Chinese.
Produce 10 Longbowmen units and use their Palings ability in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the English.
Longbowmen can place down Palings to slow down cavalry units.
Build the Guild Hall and accumulate 500 Wood in any game mode as the French.
Defeat 20 units with Landsknecht units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Holy Roman Empire.
The Landsknecht can be produced from the Barracks upon reaching the Castle Age (III).
Produce 10 Sheep with Pastures in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Mongols.
Construct Pastures instead of Farms to raise Sheep for Food — Pastures produce Sheep quicker when within the influence of an Ovoo.
Produce 5 Streltsy units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Rus.
Streltsy can be produced from an Archery Range after reaching the Imperial Age.
Defeat 10 units with Elephant units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Delhi Sultanates.
The elephants produced do not need to come from the Palace of the Sultan, however it does help.
Recapture Grainville in the Battle of Brmule mission on any difficulty.
Increase the yield of 10 Berry Bushes then accrue 3,000 Food as the Abbasid Dynasty or as the Delhi Sultanates.
Constructing a Mill near Berry Bushes increases the amount of Food available.
Play a 2v1 Multiplayer match with a friend against any AI difficulty.
Last at least 10 minutes in a 8 players Free For All Multiplayer match.
Win a 1v1 Multiplayer match that results in a Landmarks Victory.
Research the Anatolian Hills Imperial Council upgrade then Accrue 1000 Gold as the Ottomans in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Accrue 500 Food from the Ranch in a match as the Malians in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Use the Mill to produce Cattle. Cattle will generate Food over time when assigned to the Ranch building.
Defeat 10 enemy units using Villagers when playing as the English in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Accrue 500 Food from the Granary as the Chinese in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Play the Siege of Paris mission and make sure all Villagers survive the initial attack on any difficulty.
Have at least 25 simultaneously inspired Villagers as the Holy Roman Empire in any game mode.
Research all the Age I and Age II Improved Gather Technologies when playing as the Mongols in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Hunt and Kill 1 Boar using Villagers when playing as the Rus in any game mode.
Research the Village Fortresses upgrade then Produce 10 Villagers from a Keep as the Delhi Sultanates in any game mode.
Build 5 Outposts and Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match as the Abbasid Dynasty.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match on the Enchanted Grove biome.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match where Wood is only obtained through trading after reaching Age II as the French.
You must reach Age II for completion to be registered.
Research the Lumber Preservation upgrade from the Lumber Mill and gather 2,000 Wood.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match using the Thick Woods mod.
Construct 15 Farms and research all Mill upgrades in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the English.
Research the Tithe Barns upgrade and accrue 2,000 Wood from Relics in a Multiplayer or Skirmish game.
Kill the Enchanted Stag in a Multiplayer or Skirmish game.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match in which you haven't killed any animals or Fish.
Produce 10 Cattle before you reach the Castle Age(III) in a Multiplayer match playing as the Malians.
Use the Mill to produce Cattle. Cattle will generate Food over time when assigned to the Ranch building.
Play with a friend on your team in a 2v1 Multiplayer match and have 20 of your own simultaneous Farms.
Gather 1000 Fish as a Food Source with Fishing Boats in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Win a 2v2 Multiplayer or Skirmish match while playing on the map Marshland.
Collect 1000 Food in a Ranked Season match
Reach the Imperial Age (IV) in a Ranked match
Herd Sheep to a building 5 times in a Ranked match
Destroy 10 enemy ships in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match on a water map.
Water maps are marked with an anchor icon in map selection.
Build 20 Stone Wall segments in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Win a Multiplayer match with at least one friend on your team in which you used a Taunt.
Future's So Bright I Gotta Wear Shades
Construct 10 Toll Outposts, then defeat 5 units with Toll Outposts as the Malians.
Win a Multiplayer or Skirmish match in which you constructed 5 Docks.
Research the Howdahs technology, then produce 10 Tower Elephants as the Delhi Sultanate.
Research Extended Lines and use Fishing Boats to gather 2000 Fish.
Research Swivel Cannon for Springald Ships.
Build a standard Keep in any Multiplayer or Skirmish match and win the match.
Build a standard Keep, not landmarks.
Raze 10 buildings in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Herd Sheep to a building 7 times in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the French.
Wouldn't Be a Party Without You
Reach 200 unit population in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Receive the Dragon Turtle's Bounty with a Fishing Boat in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Monsters can be found on maps marked with a monster icon in map selection. Stay close to the monsters to receive their gift.
Receive the Wild Man's Boon with a Villager in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Monsters can be found on maps marked with a monster icon in map selection. Stay close to the monsters to receive their gift.
Raid at least 5 enemy buildings as the Mongols in any game mode.
Mongols specialize in raiding the land and gain resources from destroying enemy structures. This allows them both to stay on the offense and to build up their economy.
Accrue 2000 Wood before reaching the Feudal Age (II) while playing on the Black Forest map in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Construct a Pagoda in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match as the Chinese.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match where Food is gathered only from animals.
Win a 2v2 Quick Match in which you reach the Imperial Age (IV).
Accrue 1000 Food in the Hallow's Hearth biome in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Attack 30 enemies with invisible Musofadi Warriors or Gunners in a single match as the Malians.
Win a Skirmish or Multiplayer match in which you produced 100 Villagers.
Defeat 3 Wolves with ranged units in a Multiplayer or Skirmish match.
Gather 500 Food from Sheep in a 1v1 Multiplayer match.
Win a 2v2 Multiplayer match with a friend on your team.
Win a Multiplayer match on a map using the Hallow's Hearth biome.
Hunt 20 Deer on the Prairie map in any game mode.
Build the Notre Dame Wonder and Win a Multiplayer match as the French.
Play a Skirmish or Multiplayer match that results in a Wonder victory.
Win a 1v1 Skirmish match in less than 15 minutes against the Japanese.
Convert 40 units in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match while playing as the Mongols.
Defeat 2 enemy Traders using your Villagers in the Siege of Kiev mission on any difficulty.
Win a 3v1 Custom Match with 2 friends on your team against one Hard A.I.
This challenge requires you to complete it with other players that are on your Friends List.
Win a Multiplayer match in which you produced a Counterweight Trebuchet, a Springald, and a Bombard unit while playing as the Rus.
Play a 2v2 Empire Wars Multiplayer match.
Produce 15 or more units before reaching Age II in a Skirmish or Multiplayer match.
Use a Taunt during a Multiplayer match.
Win a Skirmish match that results in a Landmarks Victory against a single Intermediate A.I.
Win a game as the Byzantines.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct 3 Olive Groves, then harvest 300 Oil.
The Winery Landmark further improves the effectiveness of nearby Olive Groves.
Use Cisterns to improve the gathering rate of 15 Villagers simultaneously.
Each Cistern connected to your Aqueduct network improves the gathering bonus of every Cistern in the network.
Defeat 5 enemy units using Greek Fire.
Cheirosiphons along with upgraded Dromons and Trebuchets use Greek Fire.
Construct 2 buildings within the influence of a Cistern before reaching the Feudal Age (II).
Buildings constructed within the influence of Cisterns enjoy increases to gathering rate, unit production, research speed, and fire armor.
Construct the Imperial Hippodrome and activate a Triumph that lasts at least 45 seconds.
To increase Triumph time, use more Supply Points.
Defeat 1 enemy unit with Villagers using Akritoi Defense.
This ability can be used from any Cistern. Nearby Villagers equip spears for a short time.
Improve your Town Center to Daimyo Manor and Produce a Bannerman.
Use Stone to improve your Town Center, improving the production of Farms, and unlocking Bannermen.
Defeat 15 units with Limitanei while Shield Wall is active.
The Limitanei can use a Shield Wall ability to take less damage from enemy ranged units.
Produce 15 Cataphracts and then trample enemy units 20 times.
Cataphracts have a devastating Trample ability which damages enemies in their path.
Defeat 5 enemy units with a Samurai before Age III.
Samurai armor has a chance to deflect a portion of incoming ranged or melee damage.
Win a game as the Japanese.
Win one game in any type of match including campaign.
Defeat 15 enemy infantry units with Onna-Bugeisha.
Onna-Bugeisha are a fast unit with a longer range melee weapon.
Produce 10 Varangian Guards and then defeat 15 enemies while berserking.
Varangian Guard are available in the Castle Age.
Construct the Koka Township and Produce 10 Shinobi.
Shinobi can use their Spy ability to take on the appearance of an enemy Villager. Use it to gather intelligence on your opponent's plans!
Construct a Mercenary House next to a neutral Trade Post, sign a contract, and fully upgrade the contract units to Elite.
Building a Mercenary House adjacent to a Trade Post unlocks the ability to choose a Mercenary Contract, which in turn unlocks new units.
Research the Greek Fire Trebuchet and then destroy 20 buildings using Trebuchets.
The Greek Fire Trebuchet can be researched from the Siege Workshop.
Defeat 10 enemy Spearmen with Yumi Ashigaru.
Strong against light armored melee infantry, Yumi Ashigaru can be built from Age II onwards.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Use Shinto Priests to place a Yorishiro into any building to provide special bonuses. Yorishiro are produced by the Floating Gate Landmark in Age (III).
Construct the Floating Gate Landmark to generate Yorishiro and acquire the ability to construct Shinto Shrines.
Research Do-maru Armor and defeat 30 enemy units with Mounted Samurai.
The Do-maru armor upgrade can be researched in Age IV at the Stables.
Win five games in any type of match including campaign.
Construct the Castle of the Crow Landmark and trade with the Treasure Caravan 3 times during Age IV.
After building this Landmark, a Treasure Caravan will periodically appear on the map and come to trade at the Landmark. Protect them as they make their journey!
Win a match as the Byzantines.
Construct a Transport Ship with a Varangian Guard and garrison it to maximum capacity as the Byzantines.
Increase the movement speed of 40 Onna-Musha using a Kabura-ya Whistling Arrow.
Onna-Musha and the Kabura-ya Whistling Arrow are available in the Archery range in Age III.
Recruit 60 mercenaries from a Mercenary House in a single match as the Byzantines.
Defeat 200 enemies with Limitanei while Shield Wall is active as the Byzantines.
Destroy 50 buildings with Cheirosiphons as the Byzantines.
Build 10 Cisterns in a single match as the Byzantines.
Accrue 2,000 Olive Oil in a single match as the Byzantines.
Use the Conversion ability with a Buddhist Monk and inspire 10 of your nearby units.
Inspired allies will have increased damage for a short time.
The Tanegashima Gunsmith Landmark produces Ozutsu units.
Win ten games in any type of match including campaign.
Have 20 Trade Ships trading simultaneously during the Raiders of the Red Sea.
In the Lead by a Quarter Nile
Capture all Control Points during Into Egypt.
Eliminate all 3 enemy leaders within 30 seconds of each other during the Battle of Mansurah.
Rescue all the prisoners during the Invasion of Cyprus.
Win a match as the Japanese.
Heal 20 units using Shinto Priest units in a single match as the Japanese.
Spend Stone to research all Town Center upgrades as the Japanese.
Convert Stone to Gold at a Forge 250 times in a single match as the Japanese.
Use Sabotage to disable 50 buildings with Shinobi units as the Japanese.
Defeat 50 siege units using Ozutsu units as the Japanese.
Enhance 10 resource drop-off buildings by depositing a Yorishiro as the Japanese.
Complete Chapter 2 of the Sultans Ascend - Egypt, Red Sea, and Hattin
Complete Chapter 3 of the Sultans Ascend - Mansurah, Ayn Jalut, and Acre
